remarks: The orthocomplement of a kernel is either an atom or zero.  (Contributed by NM, 29-Jan-2015.)
statement:
dochsat0.h $e |- H = ( LHyp ` K ) $.
dochsat0.o $e |- ._|_ = ( ( ocH ` K ) ` W ) $.
dochsat0.u $e |- U = ( ( DVecH ` K ) ` W ) $.
dochsat0.z $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` U ) $.
dochsat0.a $e |- A = ( LSAtoms ` U ) $.
dochsat0.f $e |- F = ( LFnl ` U ) $.
dochsat0.l $e |- L = ( LKer ` U ) $.
dochsat0.k $e |- ( ph -> ( K e. HL /\ W e. H ) ) $.
dochsat0.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. F ) $.
dochsat0 $p |- ( ph -> ( ( ._|_ ` ( L ` G ) ) e. A \/ ( ._|_ ` ( L ` G ) ) = { .0. } ) ) $.
